name: AccountsPayable-SupplierInvoiceRequests-GET-get_type_viewContent
description: [Accounts Payable] GET /supplierInvoiceRequests/{ID}/attachments/{subresourceID}?type=viewContent — Secured by: Process: Supplier Invoice - Request, View: Supplier Invoice Request Scope: Supplier Accounts Contains attachment(s)

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: subresourceID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

name: AccountsPayable-SupplierInvoiceRequests-GET-getSupplierInvoiceRequests
description: [Accounts Payable] GET /supplierInvoiceRequests — Retrieves a collection of supplier invoices.

schema.name: company
schema.description: The company for the Common Financial Dimensions. This is for internal use only on a REST API.

schema.name: fromDueDate
schema.description: The  beginning date of the payment due period for this supplier invoice request. Use the MM/DD/YYYY format. Example: When the payment term is Net 30, the due date value is the day from this invoice date.

schema.name: fromInvoiceDate
schema.description: The date on or after which the supplier invoice is created using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: requester
schema.description: The ID of the worker generating the supplier invoice request.

schema.name: status
schema.description: The status of the supplier invoice request. This is for internal use only on a REST API.

schema.name: supplier
schema.description: The supplier on the business documents.

schema.name: toDueDate
schema.description: The end date of the payment due period for this supplier invoice request. Use the MM/DD/YYYY format. Example: When the payment term is Net 30, the due date value is 30 days from the invoice date.

schema.name: toInvoiceDate
schema.description: The date on or before which the supplier invoice is created using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

name: AccountsPayable-SupplierInvoiceRequests-POST-postSupplierInvoiceRequests
description: [Accounts Payable] POST /supplierInvoiceRequests — Creates the supplier invoice as specified in the request.

schema.name: requestBody
schema.description: JSON request body.
